No disease suffered by a live man can be known.
Every living person has his own peculiarities.

The disease Natásha suffered from was not a disease of the lungs, liver, skin, heart, nerves, and so on mentioned in medical books.
The disease Natásha suffered from was a disease consisting of one of the innumerable combinations of the maladies of those organs.

Doctors satisfied the need for hope of relief, for sympathy, and for something to be done.
Doctors satisfied the need seen in a child when it wants to have a place rubbed that has been hurt.
A child knocks itself and runs to the arms of its mother or nurse to have the aching spot rubbed or kissed.
A child feels better when its aching spot is rubbed or kissed.
A child cannot believe that the strongest and wisest of its people have no remedy for its pain.
The child's hope of relief and the expression of its mother's sympathy while she rubs the bump comforts it.
